intro: Silene seelyi, commonly known as the Seely's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-elevation regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Silene seelyi is a perennial species with a low-growing habit, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems and a subject of interest for botanists studying plant adaptation to harsh environments.
